Say, you need to set up a makeshift EEG lab in an office? Easy-peasy---only, try to move the hardware as little as possible, especially laptops with dongles sticking out. The rest is a trail of snapshots devoid of captions, clutter, a sink and a shower room, as this is only an ancillary, temporary, extraordinary little lab, and all those staples are within reach in our mainstream lab (see [Ledwidge et al., 2018](#reference)).

<i class="fas fa-smile"></i>&nbsp; The needles below are *blunt*---that is, they do not pierce the skin. They're just used to put some gel into the cap to enable the detection of electrical activity in the brain.
